message: For instance, I would like to be able to turn some extra debug logging on when in IRB, since that would be a case where the user likely wants to know that extra information
Is it possible to write a script that--when required within an irb session--can do something different, like prompt the user for information or whatnot?
Or if I have a type of activeRecord gem or model, that if I start an IRB session, it could prompt the user to log in to the db explicitly by prompting for a username/password
that would simplify how you would test out a gem for usefulness if you didn't want to have them set up some config .yml or something ahead of time.
you could set a constant in your ~/.irbrc and then check for that constant
or you can check for `defined?(IRB) && IRB.CurrentContext`
